alert.note: Alert for Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:11PM EST until February 18 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN and Ripley. In Southwest Ohio, Butler, Clermont, Clinton, Hamilton and Warren. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 PM EST, radar showed that the heavy rain has tapered off. However, areal flooding is still ongoing in the warned area. This will continue into tonight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Oxford, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin and Springdale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
